name: Chris Gregory
biography:
Christopher Gregory Rivera is a Puerto Rican photographer and director based in New York City and San Juan, Puerto Rico.

His work is particularly interested in rescuing and reconfiguiring historic narratives through documentary, still life and archival research to promote a better understanding of the present. 

He draws on his background as a documentarian and researcher to tell empowering stories that are true to life in their intensity, fantasy and beauty.

name: Yael Martinez
biography:
Martínez's work has explored the connections between, poverty, drug trafficking, organized crime, and how this affects on the communities in his native Guerrero in southern Mexico

He is trying to represent the relationship of absence and presence and this state of invisibility in a symbolic manner working with the concepts of pain, emptiness, absence, and forgetting.

Martínez is based in Guerrero, Mexico.

name: Maria Terrone
biography:
Maria Terrone (Jackson Heights/Roosevelt Avenue - E) is the author of the poetry collections Eye to Eye (Bordighera Press, 2014); A Secret Room in Fall (McGovern Prize, Ashland Poetry Press).

Her work, which has been published in French and Farsi and nominated four times for a Pushcart Prize, has appeared in media including POETRY, Ploughshares, Poetry Daily, The Hudson Review, and in more than 25 anthologies. (INCREASE BIO CHARACTER LIMIT)
